title: Retro marquee heading style
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414235700im_/http:/www.tncbusinesscards.com/unknownfont.jpg)

Does anyone know what this font is?

(Please ignore the blurriness of the "T" -- I had enlarged it for the sample so there would be some representation of it included).

Any help is greatly appreciated.

Font: 

 Plaza Bold, modified (probably) 

Solved By: 

 [Lex Kominek](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414235700/http:/typophile.com/user/5398 "View user profile.")
author: TNC

comments.content:
[Plaza](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414235700/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/efscangraphic/plaza-sh/heavy/), with an alternate 'R'. Not sure if there's a digital version with that character.

- Lex

It's really hard to tell with the blur, but it looks like [Plaza Ultra](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414235700/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/itc/plaza/).  
The T R and S don't match, but they could have been customized ... ?
That's close! I'm still seeing some differences, though, in the "T," "R," "S," and "A," which isn't in the above sample, nor in the alternate sets.
